newsitem.title: USA: Sled Dogs signs forbearance pact.
newsitem.headline: Sled Dogs signs forbearance pact.

text.p: Sled Dogs Co, which makes snow skates and related accessories, said Wednesday it signed a forbearance agreement with Norwest Credit Inc, its asset-based lender.

Norwest agreed to forbear from exercising its rights and remedies as a secured creditor until either September 30, failure by the company to meet its obligations under the agreement, or default by the company under any other loan agreement, whichever is earlier.
Sled Dogs chief financial officer Mike Wise said the company has been in default of its loan agreement since March 1997. As of March 31, it owed $620,000. The current balance due was not disclosed.
Under the forbearance agreeement, Sled Dogs must repay the amounts due under the loan on October 1.
If the loan is not repaid, Norwest Credit will have the option to take over Sled Dog's assets or to have Sled Dogs liquidate its assets.

"We are hopeful that the company can meet its obligations under the forbearance agreement," chairman Kent Rodriguez said in a statement. "The company continues to work on securing additional capital and is in the process of searching for another asset-based lender to step into (Norwest's) position."
Wise said Norwest is currently Sled Dog's only asset-based lender.
